citation.article-title: Actinomyces catuli sp. nov., from dogs
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Actinomyces catuli sp. nov.
Actinomyces catuli (ca'tu.li. L. masc. n. catulus small dog; L. masc. gen. n. catuli of a small dog)
Cells are straight to slightly curved rods which stain Gram-positive, are non-acid-fast and non-motile.
Colonies are tiny, irregular, convex, white and adherent to medium at colony base.
End products of glucose metabolism are acetic, lactic (major) and succinic acids.
Using API systems, acid is produced from D-glucose, maltose, lactose, D-raffinose, ribose, sucrose, trehalose and D-xylose.
Acid is not produced from D-arabitol, cyclodextrin, glycogen, mannitol, melezitose, pullulan, sorbitol or tagatose.
Acid may or may not be produced from L-arabinose, melibiose and methyl β-D-glucopyranoside.
Aesculin is hydrolysed but gelatin and hippurate are not.
Acid phosphatase, ester lipase C8, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, leucine arylamidase, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase and pyrazinamidase are produced.

Alanine phenylalanine proline arylamidase, alkaline phosphatase, cystine arylamidase, α-fucosidase, glycyl tryptophan arylamidase, lipase C14, α-mannosidase, β-mannosidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, chymotrypsin, trypsin, valine arylamidase and urease are not produced.
Activities for arginine dihydrolase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, esterase C4 and agalactosidase may or may not be detected.
